analysis: The documents all pertain to the establishment, modification, or continuation of advisory committees, commissions, or councils by the President of the United States. These entities are created to provide advice and recommendations on a wide range of issues, from industrial competitiveness and international labor to small business, social security reform, space activities, human radiation experiments, radiation policy, foreign language studies, government housing, recreation and natural beauty, private sector initiatives, tax reform, intellectual disabilities, science and technology, bioethics, export policy, national security telecommunications, trade and environment, circuit judge nominations, narcotic and drug abuse, employment of the handicapped, career executive programs, industrial peace, tax court membership, ethical problems in medicine, business in Africa, broadcasting to Cuba, and personnel interchange. The documents outline the composition, functions, administrative provisions, and termination dates of these advisory bodies. They also delegate authority and ensure compliance with the Federal Advisory Committee Act.
title: Presidential Advisory Groups
